website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Breakthru 4 came into the industry with grace, but not with a bang. While neutral runners were positive about its affordable price, it’s lightweight build, and its appealing color schemes, some of them felt that its midsole wasn’t as comfortable. One person even claimed that something was causing some discomfort to the arch of the foot.
pros: The toe box of the Saucony Breakthru 4 was broad enough for toe-splay, several users commented
The available colorways for this running shoe were visually endearing, some people noted
Most consumers welcomed the price tag, stating that it’s affordable
The lightweight nature of this product gained the favor of its testers
The sizing scheme followed most people’s expectations
cons: A few testers complained that the midsole was stiffer and less responsive than the previous version
According to a consumer, there was a lump in the sole unit that tended to grab the arch uncomfortably

customer_reviews.title: Saucony is headed in the right direction
customer_reviews.text: I had the Breakthru 3 and liked it . This shoe improves the 3 by having a larger toe box. The 3 seemed to be the most narrow Saucony shoe (and I have had a lot of them). I love the look and feel of these. Lightweight and airy. My only knock is that I wish it had just a tad more cushion for the front part of your foot. I pound hard on that area. I run exclusively on a treadmill...9-18 miles per week (depends on how busy I get).
customer_reviews.author: Joe Howard

customer_reviews.title: ... are the only shoes I have found that are comfortable without any inserts
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and these are the only shoes I have found that are comfortable without any inserts.
customer_reviews.author: uncleArby

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, lightweight shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Saucony Breakthru 4’s. I put in excess of 300 miles on the last pair, which is pretty remarkable considering how light they are. I wear a Plantar Fasciitis insole in the shoe and have had zero foot problems since I started using this shoe/insole combination. Very comfortable shoe. The bottoms wore well and would be good for a few more miles had I not worn a “raggedy” pair of socks a couple of times and rubbed holes in the inside of the heel. I’ll definitely pick up another pair of these soon.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Underrated running shoes at a good value
customer_reviews.text: A highly underrated Saucony shoe. Oh, and please call the company SAU-kuh-nee. They do...not suh-KOH-nee. That being said, if you’re a fan of the brand, this is a great lightweight trainer in between the kinvara and the ride. For me, it’s better than both of those shoes. Oh, and they are running shoes, so don’t buy them if you want casual, everyday, or walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for any runners.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for a runner. Light weight, breathable, supportive in the right areas. I run 5-10 miles a day 5-6 days a week and I like these so much that I’ve purchased 4 pair to get me through this next year since running is a big part of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Nice running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and fit very well. This is my first pair Saucony’s and I’m very pleased with them. I have plantar fasciitis and these seem to help my feet out in that regard. They are a purple grayish color but they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, may run a tad big?
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a running shoe snob but I’ve had an old pair that I’ve ran off and on with for 4 years and so I figured I better get some new ones before knees explode. These feel great, are comfortable, and make my runs easier all around. I’m 6’3 210lbs, run around 15 miles a week. I got a size 13 in these, which is my usual, but they seemed a little big so I laced them up and extra notch and they work great. Overall good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Moss

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a different shoe and having problems with calf burnout and knee problems. My runs are much more comfortable and longer wearing these shoes. I bought them on a recommendation by a friend and I'm glad I listened.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Geertsen

customer_reviews.title: It all depends on what you're looking for in a shoe I wasn't happy
customer_reviews.text: The quality is not what I expected for the price I was paying I literally could have gone to Walmart and got him a pair of shoes that would have been comparable to what I got
customer_reviews.author: Supermaticshark

customer_reviews.title: What they look like at 275+ miles.
customer_reviews.text: See the photos. After 275+ miles you can see the wear on the tread, all miles logged on roads. Not the small areas of were in the heel and on the portion of the right shoe. May just be the way I run....Decent shoe for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mtlatc

customer_reviews.title: Saucony running shoes
customer_reviews.text: first time withe this brand appears to be well constructed very comfortable and a great price use them to walk 5 mile
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good color,great price
customer_reviews.text: He likes them and wears them daily. I like the colors. They are standing up for daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jason's Wife

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes and very durable. I’m hell on shoes so any pair that hold up to my daily abuse is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Will buy agian.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Brooks but they're too expensive, even on Amazon Brooks are priced high. So I shopped around and found a pair of saucony Everun. For the money they fit right, they're comfortable and price just right. And most of all you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott fulmer

customer_reviews.title: Purple shoes-NOT gray
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to say that I love saucony shoes, they are the only shoes I run in! I bought these for my husband because they appear to be a nice gray color...but they arrived and they are purple, not gray.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Ippolito

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice, breathable shoe. Have had them for six months and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I recently started walking five keys. The shoes are great comfort, very light weight, and exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vanover

customer_reviews.title: Saucony
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and they fit great. But the sole are uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: FmVilla1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: The color seems more purple than gray, but they are beautiful shoes.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The fit is true.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and the fit is good. I order them on line because the fit runs true,
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe. Fast shipping !!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking shoe. Fits correctly and feels very comfortable on my feet. Look better in person than in the advertising pics.
customer_reviews.author: qhorse13

customer_reviews.title: Purple, not gray.
customer_reviews.text: This show is purple, not gray. Fit is great as I own the yellow version.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fit, as any Saucony men's shoe
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any complaints about those shoes. I'm using the same shoe for many years. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Moti

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and support
customer_reviews.text: Pumped about these, and I’ve been loving them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and great for training. Not as much support as the guide or ride saucony shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: They cut me heal badly when running. Other than that they’re a good shoe
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Buying more
customer_reviews.text: This is a really comfortable shoe and compared to Nike is made better and is very comfortable if you are wanting to get away from overpriced Nike who backs people that cause trouble this is a great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bolena

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking, nit running
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for over a year now. I've run a few times in them and my feet always started hurting at mile 3, so I stopped using them for running. They are pretty good for walking though. My feet feel much better when running in Brooks Launch 6/7.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Breakthru 4 Fitness Shoes
product_meta.description: The breakthru 4 have the top mesh part redesigned for a dynamic fit. This shoe gives us an unbeatable feeling under the feet, along with the everun, to meet all the needs of the race. Whether it’s a day of competition or a day of shooting, advance your goals.
feature_bullets: EVERUN Topsole construction for engery resturn and cushion
